resources.string: Reduce hours of leaf wetness by plant spacing and density, as well as irrigation management. Destroy old onion cull piles and bury field debris. Avoid injuring onions during production Properly cure bulbs in the field; lift and allow them to dry several days before topping.

Protective fungicides must be applied repeatedly to prevent purple blotch on the majority of commercial onion crops. Every two weeks applications of preventative solutions containing the fungicides boscalid, chlorothalonil, fenamidone, and mancozeb (all at 0.20 - 0.25%) can begin one month after transplanting.

When the leaves are left moist over long periods of time in chilly, rainy weather (10 degrees Celsius to 24 degrees Celsius), onion leaf blight is most frequently an issue. \n\nRemove all crop waste from onions (leave no tops on the soil) and any onions that have grown out of the soil to control onion leaf blight. Additionally, you should rotate your crops and ensure enough air circulation. Some kinds are resistant to it to a certain level.

An integrated approach of preventive measures and biological treatments, including azoxystrobin + difenoconazole, boscalid + pyraclostrobin, chlorothalonil, iprodione, mancozeb, and prochloraz, is highly effective in reducing S. vesicarium growth, especially in cool and dry weather conditions, and can be enhanced with product substitution.

You managed to catch a healthy onion leaf. Kindly snap another picture of the spring onion.
It doesn\'t seem like the photo you took shows a spring onion. In order to start the disease detection process, please take a picture of a spring onion.
